data.name: Array Imposter (a.k.a. String Undercover)
data.description:
Make it possible to treat a string as a comma-delimited array and avail array methods to it with a "stringArray function" in the following format: ```javascript var x = stringArray(array, jsFunction, argumentString) ``` For example: ```javascript var blah = stringArray("1,2,3", "push", "10,10,10"); // blah = "1,2,3,10,10,10" ```
#####Technical Notes: * "array" argument should accept a comma-delimited array string or an integer * "jsFunction" argument should accept array function labels but also "length" and array indexes which should just return the corresponding array property value * "argumentString" argument should accept a comma-delimited array string or an integer * If the array function is a mutating function you should return the new mutated array, for example: ```javascript var blah = stringArray("1,hey,3","pop") // blah = "1,hey" var blah = stringArray("1,hey,3","splice","2,1,add,this,stuff") // blah = "1,hey,add,this,stuff" ```
